issue.title: Widgets moves when changing value in reactive object

labels.name: type: bug
labels.description: Something isn't correct or isn't working

issue.body:
I would expect to be able to drag the slider without the widgets moving down. But that is not the case.

![reactive-expressions](https://github.com/holoviz/panel/assets/42288570/586b6e6a-af2a-4a6e-8d0c-0e3b1c343880)

```python
import numpy as np
import pandas as pd

from param import rx
import panel as pn

pn.extension()

URL = 'https://datasets.holoviz.org/penguins/v1/penguins.csv'

df = rx(pd.read_csv(URL))
style = rx('color: white; background-color: {color}')

nrows = pn.widgets.IntSlider(value=2, start=1, end=10)
color = pn.widgets.ColorPicker(value='darkblue')

def highlight_max(s, props=''):
    if s.dtype.kind not in 'f':
        return np.full_like(s, False)
    return np.where(s == np.nanmax(s.values), props, '')

styled_df = df.head(nrows).style.apply(highlight_max, props=style.format(color=color), axis=0)

pn.Column(styled_df).servable()
```

comment.body: I'll change the default and add a notebook documenting the `pn.pane.ReactiveExpr`.

issue.title: Fix from_param type annotation
issue.body:
In one of my applications `mypy` was complaining that `_table` in `self._table = pn.widgets.Tabulator.from_param` needed a type annotation.

I believe its because the `cls` needs the type annotation as described in https://stackoverflow.com/questions/46007544/python-3-type-hint-for-a-factory-method-on-a-base-class-returning-a-child-class.

Furthermore I think `T` should not be bound to `'Widget'`.

When I applied these changes mypy no longer complained.

pull_request.title: Fix from_param type annotation
pull_request.body:
In one of my applications `mypy` was complaining that `_table` in `self._table = pn.widgets.Tabulator.from_param` needed a type annotation.

I believe its because the `cls` needs the type annotation as described in https://stackoverflow.com/questions/46007544/python-3-type-hint-for-a-factory-method-on-a-base-class-returning-a-child-class.

Furthermore I think `T` should not be bound to `'Widget'`.

When I applied these changes mypy no longer complained.

issue.title: Describe how to sync the url/ location to a list of Parameterized objects

labels.name: type: enhancement
labels.description: Minor feature or improvement to an existing feature

labels.name: type: docs
labels.description: Related to the Panel documentation and examples

issue.body:
I've just contributed https://github.com/holoviz/panel/pull/5752. I was looking at this because I want to `sync` with a list of Parameterized classes.

If I can figure out how to get something like the below example working, I would like to contribute it to the docs.

```python

import param
import panel as pn

class Curve(param.Parameterized):
    product = param.String()

class CurveCollection(param.Parameterized):
    value = param.List(class_=Curve)

    add = param.Event()
    index = param.Integer()

    @param.depends("add", watch=True)
    def _add_curve(self):
        self.value = self.value + [Curve(product=str(self.index))]
        self.index+=1

collection=CurveCollection()
pn.state.location.sync(collection, parameters=["value"])

pn.Column(
    collection.param.add, collection.param.value
).servable()
```

Currently when you click the `add` button you get

```bash
  File "/home/jovyan/repos/mt-quant-frontend/.venv/lib/python3.10/site-packages/panel/io/location.py", line 194, in _update_query
    val = json.dumps(val)
  File "/opt/conda/lib/python3.10/json/__init__.py", line 231, in dumps
    return _default_encoder.encode(obj)
  File "/opt/conda/lib/python3.10/json/encoder.py", line 199, in encode

    chunks = self.iterencode(o, _one_shot=True)
  File "/opt/conda/lib/python3.10/json/encoder.py", line 257, in iterencode
    return _iterencode(o, 0)
  File "/opt/conda/lib/python3.10/json/encoder.py", line 179, in default
    raise TypeError(f'Object of type {o.__class__.__name__} '
TypeError: Object of type Curve is not JSON serializable
```

issue.title: Describe how to sync the url/ location to a list of Parameterized objects

labels.name: type: enhancement
labels.description: Minor feature or improvement to an existing feature

labels.name: type: docs
labels.description: Related to the Panel documentation and examples

issue.body:
I've just contributed https://github.com/holoviz/panel/pull/5752. I was looking at this because I want to `sync` with a list of Parameterized classes.

If I can figure out how to get something like the below example working, I would like to contribute it to the docs.

```python

import param
import panel as pn

class Curve(param.Parameterized):
    product = param.String()

class CurveCollection(param.Parameterized):
    value = param.List(class_=Curve)

    add = param.Event()
    index = param.Integer()

    @param.depends("add", watch=True)
    def _add_curve(self):
        self.value = self.value + [Curve(product=str(self.index))]
        self.index+=1

collection=CurveCollection()
pn.state.location.sync(collection, parameters=["value"])

pn.Column(
    collection.param.add, collection.param.value
).servable()
```

Currently when you click the `add` button you get

```bash
  File "/home/jovyan/repos/mt-quant-frontend/.venv/lib/python3.10/site-packages/panel/io/location.py", line 194, in _update_query
    val = json.dumps(val)
  File "/opt/conda/lib/python3.10/json/__init__.py", line 231, in dumps
    return _default_encoder.encode(obj)
  File "/opt/conda/lib/python3.10/json/encoder.py", line 199, in encode
    chunks = self.iterencode(o, _one_shot=True)
  File "/opt/conda/lib/python3.10/json/encoder.py", line 257, in iterencode
    return _iterencode(o, 0)
  File "/opt/conda/lib/python3.10/json/encoder.py", line 179, in default
    raise TypeError(f'Object of type {o.__class__.__name__} '
```

issue.title: Improve url docs
issue.body:
I think the `Location` object is really, really special and deserves more attention.

This PR tries to improve the documentation to

- Turn the example into an app that can actually be served
- Include both parameters that are synced and not synced
- Using an instance instead of a class as I believe that is the most common use case
- Adding a picture/ video to convey what we are actually talking about.

## Todo

- [ ] Upload video and replace url

## Video

https://github.com/holoviz/panel/assets/42288570/196f416a-0588-4f95-b8c3-4e12755c00ba

pull_request.title: Improve url docs
pull_request.body:
I think the `Location` object is really, really special and deserves more attention.

This PR tries to improve the documentation to

- Turn the example into an app that can actually be served
- Include both parameters that are synced and not synced
- Using an instance instead of a class as I believe that is the most common use case
- Adding a picture/ video to convey what we are actually talking about.

issue.title: pn.Param: value doesn't have a value set
issue.body:
I'm on Panel 1.3.0 and Param 2.0 trying to refresh my understanding of the `Location` object https://panel.holoviz.org/how_to/state/url.html

When I try to create a small app from the example I get  `bokeh.core.property.descriptors.UnsetValueError: Slider(id='p1105', ...).value doesn't have a value set`.

```python
import param
import panel as pn

class QueryExample(param.Parameterized):
    integer = param.Integer(default=None, bounds=(0, 10))
    string = param.String(default='A string')

query_example = QueryExample()

pn.state.location.sync(QueryExample(), {'integer': 'int', 'string': 'str'})

pn.Param(query_example).servable()
```

```bash
  File "/home/jovyan/repos/my-repo/.venv/lib/python3.10/site-packages/bokeh/core/has_props.py", line 599, in properties_with_values
    return self.query_properties_with_values(lambda prop: prop.serialized,
  File "/home/jovyan/repos/my-repo/.venv/lib/python3.10/site-packages/bokeh/core/has_props.py", line 656, in query_properties_with_values
    value = descriptor.get_value(self)
  File "/home/jovyan/repos/my-repo/.venv/lib/python3.10/site-packages/bokeh/core/property/descriptors.py", line 394, in get_value
    return self.__get__(obj, obj.__class__)
  File "/home/jovyan/repos/my-repo/.venv/lib/python3.10/site-packages/bokeh/core/property/descriptors.py", line 283, in __get__
    raise UnsetValueError(f"{obj}.{self.name} doesn't have a value set")
bokeh.core.property.descriptors.UnsetValueError: Slider(id='p1105', ...).value doesn't have a value set
```

If I change the `integer` value to 1 the example works.

I believe this is a bug and that `pn.Param` should pick another widget to support the `None` value.

issue.title: Widgets moves when changing value in reactive object

labels.name: type: bug
labels.description: Something isn't correct or isn't working

issue.body:
I would expect to be able to drag the slider without the widgets moving down. But that is not the case.

![reactive-expressions](https://github.com/holoviz/panel/assets/42288570/586b6e6a-af2a-4a6e-8d0c-0e3b1c343880)

```python
import numpy as np
import pandas as pd

from param import rx
import panel as pn

pn.extension()

URL = 'https://datasets.holoviz.org/penguins/v1/penguins.csv'

df = rx(pd.read_csv(URL))
style = rx('color: white; background-color: {color}')

nrows = pn.widgets.IntSlider(value=2, start=1, end=10)
color = pn.widgets.ColorPicker(value='darkblue')

def highlight_max(s, props=''):
    if s.dtype.kind not in 'f':
        return np.full_like(s, False)
    return np.where(s == np.nanmax(s.values), props, '')

styled_df = df.head(nrows).style.apply(highlight_max, props=style.format(color=color), axis=0)

pn.Column(styled_df).servable()
```

comment.body: I cannot find any documentation for rx in Panel, so I would not know this can be done and how?

issue.title: Contents of TooltipIcon can not be updated
issue.body:
Panel 1.2.3
Bokeh 3.2.0

My expectation would be that after clicking the button, hovering the tooltip would show the updated contents. However, it retains the original value. 

```python
import panel as pn

indicator = pn.indicators.TooltipIcon(value="hello")
but = pn.widgets.Button(name="Change tooltip")


def update(_):
    print("clicked")
    indicator.value = "Is it me, you are looking for?"


but.on_click(update)
pn.Column(indicator, but).servable()
```

comment.body:
I think `connect_signals` needs to be defined in
https://github.com/holoviz/panel/blob/main/panel/models/tooltip_icon.ts 

https://github.com/holoviz/panel/blob/main/panel/models/textarea_input.ts#L7-L13

issue.title: Implement a nested dropdown select

labels.name: type: enhancement
labels.description: Minor feature or improvement to an existing feature

issue.body: Can we have something like a nested, n-dim select dropdown built-in to Panel widgets? (I vaguely remember seeing @jlstevens implement this somewhere?) ```python import panel as pn pn.extension() WX_VARS_LEVS = {"precip": [1000], "temp": [1000, 925, 700, 500, 300], "vorticity": [500, 300]} WX_VARS = list(WX_VARS_LEVS.keys()) def update_lev_select(var): return pn.widgets.Select(options=WX_VARS_LEVS[var]) var_select = pn.widgets.Select(options=WX_VARS) lev_select = pn.bind(update_lev_select, var=var_select) pn.Column(var_select, lev_select) ``` Not sure if it's enough to support just one level, but for multiple levels, I imagine a dict of dict of list? `{"precip": {"conus": [1000], "global": [1000]}, "temp": {"conus": [1000, 925, 700, 500, 300], "global": {"temp": [1000, 500]}}}` [Here's an applicable example](https://projectpythia.org/web-map-feature-services-cookbook/notebooks/nasa_earthdata_gibs_explorer.html) of multi-level dropdowns: 1. Product 2. Layer 3. Time (potentially 4. Level)

comment.body:
Interesting idea; not entirely clear how to express that as a Python type--perhaps tuples as keys?

`{("variable", "level"): [*times]}`

issue.title: Implement a nested dropdown select

labels.name: type: enhancement
labels.description: Minor feature or improvement to an existing feature

issue.body: Can we have something like a nested, n-dim select dropdown built-in to Panel widgets? (I vaguely remember seeing @jlstevens implement this somewhere?) ```python import panel as pn pn.extension() WX_VARS_LEVS = {"precip": [1000], "temp": [1000, 925, 700, 500, 300], "vorticity": [500, 300]} WX_VARS = list(WX_VARS_LEVS.keys()) def update_lev_select(var): return pn.widgets.Select(options=WX_VARS_LEVS[var]) var_select = pn.widgets.Select(options=WX_VARS) lev_select = pn.bind(update_lev_select, var=var_select) pn.Column(var_select, lev_select) ``` Not sure if it's enough to support just one level, but for multiple levels, I imagine a dict of dict of list? `{"precip": {"conus": [1000], "global": [1000]}, "temp": {"conus": [1000, 925, 700, 500, 300], "global": {"temp": [1000, 500]}}}` [Here's an applicable example](https://projectpythia.org/web-map-feature-services-cookbook/notebooks/nasa_earthdata_gibs_explorer.html) of multi-level dropdowns: 1. Product 2. Layer 3. Time (potentially 4. Level)

comment.body: One thing to note is that it would be nice to have some more complex dependencies. For example you could have one widgets contents be dependent on two independent widgets.

comment.body: I can try creating a prototype. Would this be a `CompositeWidget`?

issue.title: Implement a nested dropdown select

labels.name: type: enhancement
labels.description: Minor feature or improvement to an existing feature

issue.body: Can we have something like a nested, n-dim select dropdown built-in to Panel widgets? (I vaguely remember seeing @jlstevens implement this somewhere?) ```python import panel as pn pn.extension() WX_VARS_LEVS = {"precip": [1000], "temp": [1000, 925, 700, 500, 300], "vorticity": [500, 300]} WX_VARS = list(WX_VARS_LEVS.keys()) def update_lev_select(var): return pn.widgets.Select(options=WX_VARS_LEVS[var]) var_select = pn.widgets.Select(options=WX_VARS) lev_select = pn.bind(update_lev_select, var=var_select) pn.Column(var_select, lev_select) ``` Not sure if it's enough to support just one level, but for multiple levels, I imagine a dict of dict of list? `{"precip": {"conus": [1000], "global": [1000]}, "temp": {"conus": [1000, 925, 700, 500, 300], "global": {"temp": [1000, 500]}}}` [Here's an applicable example](https://projectpythia.org/web-map-feature-services-cookbook/notebooks/nasa_earthdata_gibs_explorer.html) of multi-level dropdowns: 1. Product 2. Layer 3. Time (potentially 4. Level)

comment.body: So I suppose this widget should definitely support n-nesting, and I agree that I prefer `from_pandas` or `from_index` instead of a `param.DataFrame` field.

issue.title: Widgets moves when changing value in reactive object

labels.name: type: bug
labels.description: Something isn't correct or isn't working

issue.body:
I would expect to be able to drag the slider without the widgets moving down. But that is not the case.

![reactive-expressions](https://github.com/holoviz/panel/assets/42288570/586b6e6a-af2a-4a6e-8d0c-0e3b1c343880)

```python
import numpy as np
import pandas as pd

from param import rx
import panel as pn

pn.extension()

URL = 'https://datasets.holoviz.org/penguins/v1/penguins.csv'

df = rx(pd.read_csv(URL))
style = rx('color: white; background-color: {color}')

nrows = pn.widgets.IntSlider(value=2, start=1, end=10)
color = pn.widgets.ColorPicker(value='darkblue')

def highlight_max(s, props=''):
    if s.dtype.kind not in 'f':
        return np.full_like(s, False)
    return np.where(s == np.nanmax(s.values), props, '')

styled_df = df.head(nrows).style.apply(highlight_max, props=style.format(color=color), axis=0)

pn.Column(styled_df).servable()
```

comment.body: Just need to change the default widget alignment to `'top_left'`.

```python
def highlight_max(s, props=''):
    if s.dtype.kind not in 'f':
        return np.full_like(s, False)
    return np.where(s == np.nanmax(s.values), props, '')

styled_df = df.head(nrows).style.apply(highlight_max, props=style.format(color=color), axis=0)

pn.Column(styled_df).servable()
```

issue.title: Tabs not correctly sizing inside of Cards
issue.body:
#### Software Info
(this library, plus any other relevant software, e.g. bokeh, python, notebook, OS, browser, etc)
panel==1.2.3, python==3.9, Windows 10, Google Chrome

#### Description of expected behavior and the observed behavior
I am creating a Dashboard where I have multiple cards next to each other. In each card I have a list of tabs that I want the user to be able to select from, but the tabs flow over the boundary of the Card and the content inside the Card also starts overflowing. If the tabs fit inside the Card then the content sizes correctly.

#### Complete, minimal, self-contained example code that reproduces the issue
Pure Panel example
```
import panel as pn
tabs = pn.Tabs()

for i in range(20):
    tabs.append((str(i),pn.pane.Markdown(f"# TEST {i} OVERFLOWING")))

card = pn.Card(tabs,
               width=200)

card.show()



```

With plot showcase incorrect sizing
```
import panel as pn
import plotly.express as px

tabs = pn.Tabs()

plot = px.line(x=[1, 2, 3], y=[1,2,3])

for i in range(20):
    tabs.append((str(i),pn.pane.Plotly(plot.to_dict(), sizing_mode="stretch_width")))

card = pn.Card(tabs,
               width=400)

card.show()

```

#### Stack traceback and/or browser JavaScript console output
No Error messages

#### Screenshots or screencasts of the bug in action
![image](https://github.com/holoviz/panel/assets/76698239/e0dd3679-0b92-4762-95ca-8dc8a4a73522)

![image](https://github.com/holoviz/panel/assets/76698239/9f629aea-5d31-4e67-ab14-3c506529ae8f)

issue.title: Bump perspective version to 2.6.0
issue.body:
Perspective has gone through some nice UX updates and bug fixes since the version panel is currently on (1.9.2). 

Would it be possible to bump up to the latest version?

comment.body:
Not quite done here. There's two tasks remaining

1. Figure out if we can bundle the Perspective code somehow
2. Figure out why the console error related to syncing some option happens

issue.title: Panel Preview not working with another ContentsManager
issue.body:
I am using JupyterLab with an Amazon S3 backend.
When using the preview button I am getting the error:

`FileNotFoundError: [Errno 2] No such file or directory: '/notebook/path/book.ipynb'`

I think it would be fixed if the Preview button used the [Contents API](https://jupyter-server.readthedocs.io/en/latest/developers/contents.html) of the Jupyter Server.

As a workaround I have added some code in the 'jupyter_server_extension.py' so it downloads the requested notebook locally when creating the preview.
